comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: fetlife.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://fetlife.com/users/6338653/posts/10201869](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ffetlife.com%2Fusers%2F6338653%2Fposts%2F10201869) ### Comment > Historically AdGuard blocks these, which is the main reason I pay for it. Now it blocks it for a little while (maybe 30 minutes of site use) and then I have to re-teach AdGuard to block it. It takes 3-5 repetitions then it will block them for awhile again, but they start showing up again. Username: `@anonymous` ### [NSFW] Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.youtube.com/@tunetankmusic/about](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2F%40tunetankmusic%2Fabout) ### Comment > I used AdGuard on Chromium, Brave, and Firefox. While AdGuard is active I can not unsubscribe from any video on YouTube on any browser. Disabling and trying the page again fails. If I disable AdGuard, close the browsers, then restart, the unsubscribe button is visible again. I did update filters. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/cq7zhgkoi08o4skkkgwcg8ggock0socbliaty4vxnk.jpg?nc=1)

issue.title: www.youtube.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.youtube.com/@tunetankmusic/about](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2F%40tunetankmusic%2Fabout) ### Comment > I used AdGuard on Chromium, Brave, and Firefox. While AdGuard is active I can not unsubscribe from any video on YouTube on any browser. Disabling and trying the page again fails. If I disable AdGuard, close the browsers, then restart, the unsubscribe button is visible again. I did update filters. ### Screenshots

issue.title: weather.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://weather.com/weather/hourbyhour/l/1568808036e62762d835ccb5d2f98ab1e763d867a224de02a4f33b95188e8adf](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fweather.com%2Fweather%2Fhourbyhour%2Fl%2F1568808036e62762d835ccb5d2f98ab1e763d867a224de02a4f33b95188e8adf) ### Comment > weather.com has VERY aggressive ads (a side panel with multiple ads, embedded ads within the weather content, a top window ad, and sometime popups that almost cover then entire window). It is particularly annoying on the "hourly weather" selection, but occurs with all choices. Username: `@Ray from CA` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ev7z6voj4nc444o4sok40wwkocgocworzg1yw1dnmo.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Safari v1.11.13 System version: | macOS Big Sur, v 11.7.10 (20G1427) Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Social Widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Annoyances,
AdGuard Other Annoyances Other extensions used: | Coupert for Safari, Downie Safari Extension, Mate Translate

comment.body:
You are right.  AdGuard was disabled for weather.com. I have very few sites in the "allow list", so I do not ever look at the AdGuard status for individual websites. I do not remember unchecking the "Enabled" button, but I must have., probably quite a while  ago because I noticed the ads for a long time.

I usually disable AdGuard globally from the Mac menu bar if I want to temporarily access a site that complains. The site-specific "Enabled" button does not seem to satisfy some site, even with a refresh of the page. When I Enabled weather.com, the site refreshed automatically and ad were gone. Thank-you; sorry If I made extra work for you.

With AdGuard enabled, Weather.com still shows "Issued by: Digisert", so I do not understand your comment that it means "HTTPS filtering is not working" since the ads are gone now.
